title: Anti-spam and quality for AI-assisted content
content:
Anti-spam and quality for AI-assisted content

Write with AI safely: no spam, all quality.

Learning goal

  • Build a quality/anti-spam checklist.
  • Apply it to one guide.

Why it matters

  • Spammy AI content is risky and can get you excluded.
  • Quality = citability + trust.

Explanation

  • Avoid: keyword stuffing, false claims, source-less data.
  • Use: cite sources, short blocks, real data.

Examples

  • Good: short, sourced claims, real data.
  • Poor: “best in the world” with no evidence.

Guided exercise (10–15 min)

  1. Create a 10-point quality/anti-spam checklist.
  2. Apply it to an existing guide and mark fixes.

Independent exercise (5–10 min)

Update one section using the checklist.

Self-check

  • Checklist done.
  • Guide reviewed.
  • One section improved.

Optional deepening

  • Google spam policies: https://developers.google.com/search/docs/essentials/spam-policies
